body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.0-1 **Reproducible in staging?:** Y **Reproducible in production?:** Y **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** No **Issue reported by:** @VictoriaExpensify (CC: @joekaufmanexpensify @dannymcclain @sonialiap) **Slack conversation**: [#migrate](https://expensify.slack.com/archives/C07NMDKEFMH/p1768357181473589) ## Action Performed: 1. Add two business bank accounts to your account 2. Connect one to the workspace successfully 3. Go to Workflows > Make or track payments > click on the bank account ## Expected Result: _This is an improvement._ 1. When an admin of a workspace clicks on the bank account in Workflows show this screen: 2. When they click `Change bank account` navigate them to this existing screen if they have other bank accounts they can add instead: 3. Else, this existing screen if they don't have an existing bank account: ## Actual Result: Today, the only option you see is to `Disconnect bank account`, so it's unclear that you need to do that first to see your other business bank accounts to change over to. ## Workaround: Disconnect first, then add another existing bank account. ## Platforms: Select the officially supported platforms where the issue was reproduced: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [ ] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [x] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos In-line above. body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.1-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/test-runs/TR-2945/folder/13176791/59413485/1123997648 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** N/A **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** iPhone 16 pro/ 26.2 **App Component:** Money Requests ## Action Performed: Precondition: Create a manual expense to workspace chat 1. Open app 2. Navigate to workspace chat having a manual expense 3. Tap on expense preview for go to detail page 4. Tap More button and select Split 5. Tap two times on Add split 6. Put cursor on the last row 7. Slide up screen for see the last row 8. Put cursor on the last row ## Expected Result: User can see the last row while put cursor on it ## Actual Result: After put cursor on the last row, keyboard appears and the last row is hidden. Slide up screen, keyboard is dismissed, user see the last row but tap on it, last row is hidden again. ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [ ] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [ ] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/31b01328-787b-4500-a32f-59edab37011f [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

body:
If you haven’t already, check out our [contributing guidelines](https://github.com/Expensify/ReactNativeChat/blob/main/contributingGuides/CONTRIBUTING.md) for onboarding and email contributors@expensify.com to request to join our Slack channel! ___ **Version Number:** v9.3.1-0 **Reproducible in staging?:** Yes **Reproducible in production?:** Yes **If this was caught during regression testing, add the test name, ID and link from BrowserStack:** https://test-management.browserstack.com/projects/2219752/folder/13176725/test-cases/41237085 **Email or phone of affected tester (no customers):** leungbratt6+p2p@gmail.com **Issue reported by:** Applause Internal Team **Bug source:** Exploratory - Significant User Experience Deterioration **Device used:** Windows 10/Chrome **App Component:** User Settings ## Action Performed: Preconditions: Enable wallet for 2 different users and user B with 2 bank accounts a USD Bank account and a NON-US bank account (set default USD currency) 1. As User A - Pay user B so they have a positive amount in their wallet if needed 2. As User B - Navigate to Wallet and Click “Transfer balance ” 3. Select the bank account "Plaid.xxx1111" 4. Click on the Transfer button 5. Select the NON-US bank account, not the default 6. Click on the Transfer button ## Expected Result: Non-US bank account shouldn't display in the Wallet option to transfer ## Actual Result: When transferring to a US bank account, the balance is still $x.xx, but after transferring to a NON-US bank account, the balance turns to $0.00 ## Workaround: Unknown ## Platforms: - [x] Android: App - [ ] Android: mWeb Chrome - [x] iOS: App - [ ] iOS: mWeb Safari - [ ] iOS: mWeb Chrome - [x] Windows: Chrome - [ ] MacOS: Chrome / Safari ## Screenshots/Videos https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/42a0215c-dbd6-40ae-b903-7e867a3a5aec ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1dac584f-a34d-4c98-a1d2-26a789a2a7d4) [View all open jobs on GitHub](https://github.com/Expensify/App/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22Help+Wanted%22)

title: [$250] Ensure Report titles can wrap to two lines

labels.name: Reviewing
labels.description: Has a PR in review

labels.name: External
labels.description: Added to denote the issue can be worked on by a contributor

labels.name: Weekly
labels.description: KSv2

labels.name: Improvement
labels.description: Item broken or needs improvement.

body:
## Problem When moving an expense to another report the report tiles can often be long, and given they get truncated, it can be hard to understand which report is which: To get to this screen you have to: 1. Go to Reports 2. Tap Expenses in the left navigation 3. Use checkbox to select an expense 4. Tap `1 selected` button and choose `Move expense` ## Solution Let's ensure report titles can wrap to two lines here and keep everything else intact: cc @VictoriaExpensify @Expensify/design @trjExpensify
